intro: Schoenoxiphium burttii, commonly known as the Burtt's spurge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping it conserve water. Schoenoxiphium burttii is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the local flora in its native habitat.
